revised_title: Interference and Dispersion: A Study of Physical Optics
tldr: The author, Thomas Young, conducted experiments on interference and dispersion of light using knives, hair, and thin plates. He found that the interval of disappearance of light was constant and that the distribution of colors in both interference and dispersion phenomena was similar, suggesting a common cause. Young's findings supported Newton's work on thin plates and provided a deeper understanding of the behavior of light.
